definitions.definition: To throw up or vomit ; to eject what has previously been swallowed .
To cough up from the gut to feed its young , as an animal or bird does.
examples: The young gulls were fed by their mother’s regurgitated food.

definitions.definition: To repeat (information) verbatim or by rote , typically after learning it without actual comprehension .
To be thrown or poured back; to rush or surge back.
examples: Food may regurgitate from the stomach into the mouth.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To throw up or vomit ; to eject what has previously been swallowed .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To cough up from the gut to feed its young , as an animal or bird does.
( transitive , figurative , sometimes derogatory ) To repeat (information) verbatim or by rote , typically after learning it without actual comprehension .
( intransitive ) To be thrown or poured back; to rush or surge back.
